title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
oscars_won_details: Best Writing, Story and Screenplay Based on Material Not Previously Published or Produced
Best Music, Original Score for a Motion Picture (not a Musical)
description: Wyoming in the early 1900s. Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid are the leaders of a band of outlaws. After a train robbery goes wrong they find themselves on the run with a posse hard on their heels.

title: Midnight Cowboy
oscars_won_details: Best Writing, Screenplay Based on Material from Another Medium
description: A naive hustler travels from Texas to New York City to seek personal fortune, finding a new friend in a sleazy con man.

title: The Wild Bunch
description: An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West disappears around them.

title: Easy Rider
description: Two bikers head from L.A. to New Orleans through the open country and desert lands, and along the way they meet a man who bridges a counter-culture gap they are unaware of.

title: Z
description: The public murder of a prominent politician and doctor amid a violent demonstration is covered up by military and government officials.

title: Army of Shadows
description: An account of underground resistance fighters in Nazi-occupied France.

title: The Italian Job
description: Comic caper movie about a plan to steal a gold shipment from the streets of Turin by creating a traffic jam.

title: True Grit
oscars_won_details: Best Actor in a Leading Role
description: A drunken, hard-nosed U.S. Marshal and a Texas Ranger help a stubborn teenager track down her father's murderer in Indian territory.

title: They Shoot Horses, Don't They?
oscars_won_details: Best Actor in a Supporting Role
description: The lives of a disparate group of contestants intertwine in a grueling and inhumane dance marathon during the Great Depression.

title: Kes
description: A young, English working-class boy spends his free time caring for and training his pet kestrel.

title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service
description: James Bond woos a mob boss' daughter and goes undercover to uncover the true reason for Blofeld's allergy research in the Swiss Alps.

title: Anne of the Thousand Days
description: Henry VIII of England discards one wife, Katharine of Aragon, who has failed to produce a male heir, in favor of a young and beautiful woman, Anne Boleyn.

title: The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
oscars_won_details: Best Actress in a Leading Role
description: A liberated young schoolteacher at an Edinburgh girls' school in the 1930s ignores the curriculum and influences her impressionable 12-year-old charges with her romanticized world view.

title: My Night at Maud's
description: A devout Catholic man is tempted by a bold divorcée while staying the night at her apartment.

title: Cactus Flower
oscars_won_details: Best Actress in a Supporting Role
description: A dentist pretends to be married to avoid commitment, but when he falls for his girlfriend and proposes, he must recruit his nurse to pose as his wife.

title: Take the Money and Run
description: The life and times of incompetent bank robber Virgil Starkwell.

title: Support Your Local Sheriff!
description: In the old west, a man becomes a Sheriff just for the pay, figuring he can decamp if things get tough. In the end, he uses ingenuity instead.

title: The Damned
description: The downfall of a wealthy industrialist family during the reign of the Third Reich.

title: Fellini Satyricon
description: A series of disjointed mythical tales set in first century Rome.

title: Women in Love
oscars_won_details: Best Actress in a Leading Role
description: Two sisters, Gudrun and Ursula, fall in love with two best friends, Gerald and Rupert, but the relationships take different paths in 1920s England.

title: Bob & Carol & Ted & Alice
description: A sophisticated couple return from a new-age therapy session and decide to modernize their marriage, to the consternation of their conservative friends.

title: Hello, Dolly!
oscars_won_details: Best Music, Score of a Musical Picture
description: Matchmaker Dolly Levi travels to Yonkers to find a partner for "half-a-millionaire" Horace Vandergelder, convincing his niece, his two clerks, and two others to come along.

title: Le Boucher
description: A schoolteacher befriends a butcher in her small French village, but begins to suspect he may be a serial killer.

title: The Unfaithful Wife
description: A man who suspects his wife of infidelity hires a detective to spy on her, leading to tragic consequences.

title: Mississippi Mermaid
description: A wealthy plantation owner on Réunion Island marries a woman he knows only through correspondence, but the woman who arrives is not the one in the photo.

title: The Passion of Anna
description: A recluse on an island meets a woman who survived a car crash that killed her husband and son, beginning a relationship defined by deception and psychological torment.

title: Boy
description: Based on real events, a family travels across Japan making a living by faking road accidents.

title: Double Suicide
description: A paper merchant falls in love with a courtesan, but social obligations and debt drive them toward a tragic end.

title: Funeral Parade of Roses
description: A feverish collision of avant-garde aesthetics and grindhouse shocks, offering a look into the underground gay culture of 1960s Tokyo.

title: Eros + Massacre
description: Two students research the life of anarchist Sakae Osugi and his theories on free love, intertwining past and present.

title: Goyokin
description: A guilt-ridden ronin returns to his former clan to prevent a massacre he knows is being planned.

title: Medea
description: Pasolini's interpretation of the Greek legend of Jason and the Argonauts and the tragedy of Medea.

title: Pigsty
description: Two parallel stories about cannibalism: one in a medieval landscape, the other in modern Germany involving the son of a wealthy industrialist.

title: The Sorrow and the Pity
description: A documentary exploring the collaboration between the Vichy government and Nazi Germany during World War II.

title: Medium Cool
description: A TV news reporter finds himself becoming personally involved in the violence that erupts around the 1968 Democratic National Convention.

title: Alice's Restaurant
description: Arlo Guthrie plays himself in this film based on his famous song about the 1960s counterculture.

title: The Rain People
description: A pregnant housewife runs away from her husband and picks up a brain-damaged former college football player hitchhiking.

title: Downhill Racer
description: A talented but arrogant skier joins the U.S. ski team and clashes with his coach.

title: The Reivers
description: A young boy, a handyman and an employee steal a car and go on a road trip to Memphis.

title: The Sterile Cuckoo
description: A quirky, neurotic college student pursues a relationship with a shy, reserved young man.

title: Last Summer
description: During a summer holiday on Fire Island, a shy teenage girl and two boys form a bond, but their dynamic changes when a fourth person enters their circle.

title: Goodbye, Columbus
description: A Jewish librarian from the Bronx has a summer romance with a wealthy Jewish girl from Westchester.

title: Horrors of Malformed Men
description: A medical student escapes from an asylum and travels to a remote island, where he uncovers a horrific family secret.

title: Blind Beast
description: A blind sculptor kidnaps a model and imprisons her in his studio, obsessed with creating a statue of her.

title: Frankenstein Must Be Destroyed
description: Baron Frankenstein blackmails a young doctor and his fiancée into helping him perform a brain transplant.

title: The Valley of Gwangi
description: Cowboys discover a hidden valley inhabited by prehistoric creatures and try to capture an Allosaurus for a circus attraction.

title: Marooned
description: Three American astronauts are stranded in space when their retros won't fire. Can they be rescued before their oxygen runs out?

title: Sweet Charity
description: A taxi dancer continues to have faith in the human race despite endless disappointments.

title: Paint Your Wagon
description: Two unlikely prospector partners share the same wife in a California gold rush mining town.

title: Battle of Britain
description: In 1940, the British Royal Air Force fights a desperate battle to prevent the Luftwaffe from establishing air superiority over the English Channel as a prelude to a German invasion of the UK.

title: Burn!
description: A British agent is sent to a Caribbean island to foment a revolt against the Portuguese colonial rulers.

title: The Magic Christian
description: An eccentric billionaire and his homeless adopted son set out to prove that people will do anything for money.
